You, as a Business Analyst, can help your stakeholders…  only if you understand their needs.

Before the Interview

  • Find the right stakeholders to interview
  • Start with the sponsor
  • Define your goals for the interview
  • Set up the meeting
  • Choose the right setting/environment
  • Learn about your stakeholder: name, title, responsibilities

During the Interview

  • Introduce yourself and your goal/purpose for the meeting
  • Start at the high level
  • Try to understand them more deeply
  • Ask open-ended questions
  • If you don’t understand something, say so
  • Recap what they say to ensure you understand At the end, thank them
  • Ask them who else you need to speak with

After the Interview

  • Write up your notes
  • E-mail them to the stakeholder you interviewed for their input
  • Thank them again (it’s nice!)
